wikipedia_page.main: Alf Collins (Newington, 1866 - 20 December, 1951 Clapham) was a British comic, film short director and actor. His shorts include Ju-Jitsu (1907), The Dancing Girl (1908) and Rescued by Lifeboat (1906).

response: * Catch the Kid (directed by Alf Collins; comedy)
*Behind the Scenes, directed by Alf Collins
*Chased by Dogs, directed by Alf Collins

Although car chases on film were staged as early as the motor vehicle itself — one of the earliest examples being "Runaway Match" directed by Alf Collins in 1903 — the consensus among historians and film critics is that the first modern car chase movie was 1968's Bullitt.John Alfred Heitmann, The Automobile And American Life (Jefferson, NC: McFarland & Company, 2009), 182–183.Jesse Crosse, The Greatest Movie Car Chases of All Time (St. Paul: MBI Publishing, 2006), 16.Todd Gitlin, Media Unlimited: How The Torrent of Images and Sounds Overwhelms Our Lives (New York: Henry Holt and Company, 2002), 90.William Krause, Hollywood TV and Movie Cars (St. Paul: MBI Publishing, 2001), 39. The revolutionary 10-minute-long chase scene in Bullitt was far longer and far faster than what had gone before, and placed cameras so that the audience felt as though they were inside the cars. Even during the most calamitous scenes, the starSteve McQueen could be clearly seen at the wheel of the vehicle. Previously, car chase scenes were often staged using the rear projection effect.
* Behind the Scenes (1904 film), a 1904 film directed by Alf Collins
